unnormalised: New address formats can be confusing, especially with the rise of co-working spaces. The typical Indian office address often starts with a flat or unit number, followed by the building name, e.g., "Unit 201, Oberoi Towers". The next line usually includes the street name and area, like "Nariman Point, Mumbai". Don't forget to add the city and its postal code, such as "Mumbai, Maharashtra 400021".
normalised: New address formats can be confusing, especially with the rise of co-working spaces. The typical Indian office address often starts with a flat or unit number, followed by the building name, e.g., "Unit two hundred and one, Oberoi Towers". The next line usually includes the street name and area, like "Nariman Point, Mumbai". Don't forget to add the city and its postal code, such as "Mumbai, Maharashtra four hundred thousand and twenty one".

unnormalised: However, modern office spaces frequently use floor numbers within large complexes. For example, you might see "8th Floor, DLF Cyber Hub, Gurgaon". Always double-check with the recipient or online maps to avoid delivery issues. Incorrect pin codes are a very common problem.
normalised: However, modern office spaces frequently use floor numbers within large complexes. For example, you might see "eighth Floor, D-L-F Cyber Hub, Gurgaon". Always double-check with the recipient or online maps to avoid delivery issues. Incorrect pin codes are a very common problem.

unnormalised: In smaller towns, landmarks play a crucial role. An address might read "Near SBI Bank, Main Road, Patna, 800001". Companies are starting to add GPS coordinates, a move that could streamline deliveries. Keep an eye out for formats like "18.5204° N, 73.8567° E", often found alongside traditional addresses.
normalised: In smaller towns, landmarks play a crucial role. An address might read "Near S-B-I Bank, Main Road, Patna, eight hundred thousand and one". Companies are starting to add G-P-S coordinates, a move that could streamline deliveries. Keep an eye out for formats like "eighteen point five two zero four degree N, seventy three point eight five six seven degree E", often found alongside traditional addresses.
